t: Job 19
Job Feels Insulted
Then*p Job responded,
“How*pn long will you torment me And*ln crush me with words?
These*ln ten times you have insulted me; You*ln are not ashamed to wrong me.
Even*ln if I have truly erred, My*ln error lodges with me.
If*ln indeed you vaunt yourselves against me And*ln prove my disgrace to me,
Know*ln then that God has wronged me And*ln has closed His net around me.
Everything Is against Him
“Behold,*pn I cry, ‘Violence!’ but I get no answer; I*ln shout for help, but there is no justice.
He*ln has walled up my way so that I cannot pass, And*ln He has put darkness on my paths.
He*ln has stripped my honor from me And*ln removed the crown from my head.
He*ln breaks me down on every side, and I am gone; And*ln He has uprooted my hope like a tree.
He*ln has also kindled His anger against me And*ln considered me as His enemy.
His*ln troops come together, And*ln build up their way against me And*ln camp around my tent.
“He*ln has removed my brothers far from me, And*ln my acquaintances are completely estranged from me.
My*ln relatives have failed, And*ln my intimate friends have forgotten me.
Those*ln who live in my house and my maids consider me a stranger. I*ln am a foreigner in their sight.
I*ln call to my servant, but he does not answer; I*ln have to implore him with my mouth.
My*ln breath is offensive to my wife, And*ln I am loathsome to my own brothers.
Even*ln young children despise me; I*ln rise up and they speak against me.
All*ln my associates abhor me, And*ln those I love have turned against me.
My*ln bone clings to my skin and my flesh, And*ln I have escaped only*i by the skin of my teeth.
Pity*ln me, pity me, O you my friends, For*ln the hand of God has struck me.
Why*ln do you persecute me as God does,*i And*ln are not satisfied with my flesh?
Job Says, “My Redeemer Lives”
“Oh*pn that my words were written! Oh*ln that they were inscribed in a book!
That*ln with an iron stylus and lead They*ln were engraved in the rock forever!
As*ln for me, I know that my Redeemer lives, And*ln at the last He will take His stand on the earth.
Even*ln after my skin is destroyed, Yet*ln from my flesh I shall see God;
Whom*ln I myself shall behold, And*ln whom my eyes will see and not another. My*ln heart faints within me!
If*ln you say, ‘How shall we persecute him?’ And*ln ‘What pretext for a case against him can we find?’
Then*iln be afraid of the sword for yourselves, For*ln wrath brings*i the punishment of the sword, So*ln that you may know there is judgment.”
